_header: The holy feast of Easter cometh after Lent anon
Note: This text is also included as lines 15-72 of the Resurrectio Christi; see 1546.
_description: ‘Pascha’ (explanation of the Feast of Easter) in the South English Legendary — normally fifty-eight lines

BodAsh43.First Lines:
ÞE holi feste of ester comeþ after leynte anonAs our lord
                    aros fram deþe to lyue boþe in flesc & bon…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…þe rouisous ne comeþ neuere biuore seynt Markes
                    daiþer uore we wolleþ of telle in þe bigynnyng of
                    may

Bod779.First Lines:
Þe holy feste of estir comeþ after lente anonAs oure lord
                    ros fram deþ to lyue boþe in flesch & bon…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…þe reuesony comep newen be fore seint markes
                    dayþerfore we wolleþ tellen eftsone þe by gynnyng of
                    may
Bod779.Note: Second occurrence in MS; treated as part of 1301.

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
ÞE holy feste of Aster comeþ after lenton A nonAs vr lord
                    a ros from deþe to lyue boþe in flesch and bon…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…And vr lordes flesch vndurfongeþ mid his holy
                    bloodeÞat he ȝaf to stronge deþe for vs vppon þe
                    Roode
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
ÞE holy feste of ester comeþ after lenton anonas oure
                    lord aros fro dethe to liue boþe in flessh & bon…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Nou god his holi body þat for vs was y nomeLete vs so
                    his flessh afong þat we to heuene come
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

BodTan17.First Lines:
ÞE holi feste of esterne comeþ after lente a nonAs oure
                    lord a ros fro deþ to lyue bope in flesch & bon…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…God for his holi bodi þat for vs was I nomeLete vs so
                    his flesch receyue þat we to heuen come

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Þe holy feste of ester comþ after leinte anonAs oure
                    louerd aros fram deþe to lyue boþe in fleiss &
                    bon…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Þe ronisons ne comeþ neuere biuore sein markes
                    dayÞer uore we wolleþ of hom telle In þe biginnynge of
                    may
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 1.134.

CamStJohn28.First Lines:
ÞE holy feste of Ester comyth after lente a nonas oure lord
                    ros fro deþ to lyue boþe in flesch & bon…
CamStJohn28.Last Lines:
…as on holy þorysday to heuene he gan to styȝebut
                    ferst holy cherche halt þe feste of þe letanyȝe

CamTCC605.First Lines:
Þe holi fest of Estere comeþ after lente a nonas oure
                    lord aros fram deþp to lyue boþ myd flesche &
                    bon…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…Now god for his holy body þat for ous was y nomelete ous
                    so his fleche fange þat we mot to heuene come
CamTCC605.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.25.
         https://mss-cat.trin.cam.ac.uk/Manuscript/R.3.25.

BLAdd10301.First Lines:
ÞE holy feste of ester comþ after leinte anonas oure lord
                    aros fram deþ to lyue boþe ffleiss & bon…
BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
…Þe rouisons ne comeþ neuer by fore sein markes
                    dayþer for we wolleþ of him telle in þe by gynynge of
                    may
BLAdd10301.Attributed Title:
De sancto pascha (f. 61v, by scribe in margin beside
                    first line)

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: Þe holi feste of ester comeþ after lente a nonas our lord a ros fro deþ to lif boþe in flesch & bon…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …þe rouisons ne comeþ neuer bifore sein markes daiþer fore we wolleþ of hom telle in þe biginning of mai
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum xxix” added to left margin by later hand (f. 54v).
BLCottJulDIX.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library  Cotton Julius MS D IX.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Cotton_MS_Julius_D_IX.

BLEge1993.First Lines: Þe holi feste of hester comeþ after lente anonAs oure lord aros to liue biþe vlesch and bon…
BLEge1993.Last Lines: …Þe runesons comeþ neuere bifore seint markes dayÞer fore ich of hem telle in þe biginninge of may

BLEge2810.First Lines: ÞE holy fest of ester comeþ after leynt anonas vr louerd aros fram deþ to liue boþe in fless & bon…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …þe reuisons comeþ neuere be vor seynt markes dayþer vor we wolleþ telle of hom in þe byginning of maye

Lam223.First Lines:
After lentoun Aster comes þe holy feste AnonAs Crist ros from
                    deþ to lyf in flessh & in boon…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…We make vs clene þer aȝeyn ych gode man as he
                    mayÞat we may his flessh resseyve þat ros þat ilke
                    day

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
The holy fest of Ester comþ after lent anounOur lord roos from
                    deth to lyf boþ in flessh & boun…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Þat he wil wende to galile and
                    tofore ȝou þerbeAs he hym silf seide ȝou ȝe shul hym
                    þer yse
